name: Special Topics: C++ Programming for Engineers
base_name: Special Topics: C++ Programming for Engineers
long_desc: Using the C programming language as a platform, this course serves as an intermediatelevel programming course with a strong emphasis on software requirements for engineering applications. Students will refine and enhance their coding skills while applying their mathematical, analytical and design backgrounds. Topics covered include data structures, algorithm design, numerical computation, modular programming, data modeling, interactive graphics, objectorientation, and user interfaces, all in an engineeringspecific domain.

custom_fields.goals: Competence in the C programming language. Ability to use and design efficient data structures and algorithms for the engineering domain. Experience in software development.
custom_fields.key_topics: Application of software development and programming to solve engineering problems. Data model design and implementation in the C++ programming language
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: Knowledge of intermediate-level programming, including data structures, process control mechanisms, and code debugging.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: The assessment focuses largely on 8-10 assignment, but there are also 3 quizzes and a final exam.
custom_fields.relevance: All engineering students should be competent programmers in order to apply computer science concepts to engineering solutions. In particular, familiarity with C/C++ is needed for most work in robotics.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Textbooks will be recommended but not required. Web pages and expert discussion boards are better for help with coding. Course lectures will include instructor notes and be distributed through Canvas.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: It is expected that students spend about 6-7 hours per week working on assignments outside of meeting times.
